{"step_by_step_thinking": "Myofibrils are the contractile units of muscle cells. They are composed of sarcomeres, which are the basic functional units of muscle tissue. Sarcomeres contain the contractile proteins actin and myosin, which are responsible for muscle contraction. H band, A line, and sarcoplasm are all parts of the muscle cell, but they are not the contractile elements.", "answer_choice": "C. Sarcomere"}
